With an all-star international cast, this movie will transport you to different eras and cultures, and its soundtrack is simply enchanting. Would you like to give it a try?

I think "The Red Violin" would be a great fit for you! This beautifully shot film takes you on a journey through time and culture, following the red violin as it inspires passion in its various owners. With its unique storyline and stunning cinematography, I think you'll really enjoy it.

If you're looking for something a bit more intense, "The Pianist" is another great option. Directed by Roman Polanski, this powerful film tells the true story of Władysław Szpilman's struggles during WWII, featuring outstanding performances from Frank Finlay and Ed Stoppard.

I think I've got just the thing for you! Have you considered "Graduation Day"? It's a thrilling slasher film from 1981, with a killer on the loose at a school track team. The masked murderer is stalking and eliminating students one by one, and it's up to the remaining athletes to figure out who's behind the gruesome attacks.

Or if you're in the mood for something a bit more adventurous, "Escape from New York" might be right up your alley! This cult classic is set in a dystopian future where Manhattan has become a maximum-security prison, and Kurt Russell stars as Snake Plissken, a tough-as-nails convict who's sent to rescue the President. With its gritty action sequences and over-the-top stunts, this one's sure to keep you on the edge of your seat!

Considering your interest in "Graduation Day" and its deeper mood, I'd like to suggest two movies that might resonate with you. First, have you seen "Paycheck"? It's an action-packed thriller with a intriguing plot twist, starring Ben Affleck and Joe Morton. The movie's fast-paced and engaging, just like "Graduation Day"'s surprise factor.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something more lighthearted and humorous, I think you might enjoy "This Is Spinal Tap". This mockumentary is a classic comedy that explores the world of rock 'n' roll, featuring an all-star cast. Its humor and wit are sure to bring a smile to your face.

Let me know if either of these catches your eye!
